Pre-Apocalypse[]: Nothing is known about Carrie's life prior to or as the outbreak began.
Post-Apocalypse[]: At some point during the outbreak, Carrie joined a community in Ohio. During the Halloween of 2020, she won the Commonwealth's annual lottery. Carrie is among the members of the Commonwealth's high society to attend the masquerade ball held at Union Station. She is introduced to Connie and Kelly by Pamela Milton for an interview on her life in the Commonwealth since winning the lottery. Carrie also listens to Ms. Milton's speech and is horrified when Tyler Davis takes a woman hostage during the event, but is relieved when she is freed. On a sunny day in the Commonwealth, Carrie happily brings over two ice cream cones to a table where a male companion is seated. Carrie is among the residents of the city to attend services at the First Christian Church of the Commonwealth. She sits in the pews near the front and listens to Father Gabrielâ€™s sermon. With the city breached and many civilians killed as reported by Colonel Vickers and the screams heard throughout the invasion, Carrie's fate is left unknown. It is possible she was let into the Estates with the crowd of terrified citizens or was rescued later on elsewhere in the city, or was killed by the undead.

Appearances[]: " New Haunts " (No Lines) " Rogue Element " (No Lines) " Warlords " (No Lines)
Trivia[]: Carrie's romantic partner is portrayed by the actress' real-life husband. The two were specifically cast in the role of " Featured Couple ", which required an actual couple to fulfill the role. Carrie's actress, Jennifer Green Hutcheson, also portrayed a Whisperer, however they are not the same character due to Carrie having resided at the Commonwealth for at least a year as of " New Haunts ".
